page.title: 01Tarskavaig & Achnacloich Bay
page.content: Tarskavaig and Achnacloich are typicl Skye crofting villages, being valleys running down to the bay surrounded by hills. On the valley floor are the crofts, some of which are returning to wild, being covered with rushes and brocken in places, although some crofts are still being worked,hay and potatoes being the main crop. Some natural woodlnd is still to be seen in the valley floors, along the river banks or where inaccessible to grazing animals. Outside the croft boundary, the land is covered with coarse grass, heather, bracken and rocks.
